alert.note: Alert for Adair; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 8:27AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, northeastern Sequoyah and southeastern Adair Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Brushy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Muldrow... Roland... Arkoma... Moffett... Brushy... Figure Five... Lee Creek... Short... Mill Creek... Uniontown... Dora... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 320 and 328. Interstate 540 near mile marker 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
